page.title: 04WICHENFORD COURT GAMEKEEPER
page.content: {Mr. Spilsbury}is a third generation employee of{Wichenford Court.}He began his career at 13, and progressed to {Head Gamekeeper.}His main concern on the 800 acre estate is the annual flock of{400 to 500 pheasants. In November he mates 50 hens with 7 or 8 cocks and collects the 900 eggs. The eggs are{incubated at Madresfield and returned to{Wichenford as day old {chicks.}They are moved from electric hen to aviary, release pens and the wild, and are hand fed throughout. A few{partridge}and{waterfowl}are also under Mr. Spilsbury's care and he {eradicates vermin}by traps or gas. He has received{medals}from{The Three {Counties Show,}and{The Royal Show}for} long excellent service to the land. {The Court hosts four shoots}a year, and the{Worcestershire Hunt;}but there are no deer on the estate.
